page.title: 13Greystead
page.content: Greystead is not so much a hamlet, more a straggle of dwellings stretching from Low to West Greystead (now known as the Moorcock Inn). Formerly there was a school, post office and church. Now the school and post office are closed and converted to private homes. The telephone kiosk has been removed and the church is only used for weddings and funerals. Nowadays most activity centres on the Hott Farm run by the Dagg family and the Moorcock Inn where the Blaylocks are building up a reputation for bar meals. The Rectory with its two cottages is up for sale and the former church institute stands neglected. 10 dwellings-8 detached, 2 semi-det: 2: working families w/ children 2: " " w/0 " 4: elderly or retired people 2: vacant
